item.title: Erin add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "Love never dies a natural death. It dies because we don't know how to replenish its source. It dies of blindness and errors and betrayals. It dies of illness and wounds; it dies of weariness, of witherings, of tarnishings." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Erin add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Erin add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "I, with a deeper instinct, choose a man who compels my strength, who makes enormous demands on me, who does not doubt my courage or my toughness, who does not believe me naïve or innocent, who has the courage to treat me like a woman." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Erin add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "And the day came when the risk to remain tight in a bud was more painful than the risk it took to blossom." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Erin add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "Each friend represents a world in us, a world possibly not born until they arrive, and it is only by this meeting that a new world is born." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Erin add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "If what Proust says is true, that happiness is the absence of fever, then I will never know happiness. For I am possessed by a fever for knowledge, experience, and creation." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Erin add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "How wrong is it for a woman to expect the man to build the world she wants, rather than to create it herself?" -- Anais Nin

item.title: Erin add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Erin add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Erin add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "I like nonsense, it wakes up the brain cells. Fantasy is a necessary ingredient in living." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Erin add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "A person's a person, no matter how small." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Erin add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Erin add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Unless someone like you cares a whole awful lot, Nothing is going to get better. It's not." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Erin add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Sometimes the questions are complicated and the answers are simple." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Erin add a quote by Jean Fritz
item.description: "When I discovered libraries, it was like having Christmas every day." -- Jean Fritz

item.title: Erin add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Erin add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Men occasionally stumble over the truth, but most of them pick themselves up and hurry off as if nothing ever happened." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Erin add a quote by Benjamin Disraeli
item.description: "There are three types of lies -- lies, damn lies, and statistics." -- Benjamin Disraeli

item.title: Erin add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Erin add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "If ever there is tomorrow when we're not together... there is something you must always remember. You are braver than you believe, stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think. But the most important thing is, even if we're apart... I'll always be with you." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Erin add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "Sometimes, if you stand on the bottom rail of a bridge and lean over to watch the river slipping slowly away beneath you, you will suddenly know everything there is to be known." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Erin add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "What I say is that, if a man really likes potatoes, he must be a pretty decent sort of fellow." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Erin add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Loyalty to country ALWAYS. Loyalty to government, when it deserves it." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Erin add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "Think you're escaping and run into yourself. Longest way round is the shortest way home." -- James Joyce

item.title: Erin add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "I think I would know Nora's fart anywhere. I think I could pick hers out in a roomful of farting women." -- James Joyce

item.title: Erin add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I don't know the question, but sex is definitely the answer." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Erin add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Without music, life would be a mistake." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Erin add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "Without deviation from the norm, progress is not possible." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Erin add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "There is more stupidity than hydrogen in the universe, and it has a longer shelf life." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Erin add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "After silence, that which comes nearest to expressing the inexpressible is music." -- Aldous Huxley
